Draught at Taphouse. Milky golden colour with a thin white head. Fruity aroma with citrus, oranges, spicy notes. Taste is bitter. Medium bodied. Finishes slightly dry with citrus fruits and wheat malts. Very nice Wit.
From tap at Taphouse. A hazy golden coloured beer with a white head. Aroma and flavour malt, wheat, spice, coriandet and sweetness.
500ml bottle. Huge foam, what long-lasting, pale yellow colour as usual. Taste is exotic, citrus and grapefruit from hop. I liked it very much. Body is not as watery as average weizen.
Piwo wypite jakis czas temu, Ocena w ramach uzupelnienia profilu na Ratebeer

Pours in very pale liquid with a large, sturdy white foamy head. Laces the glass with a thick layer. Very nice citrus, grass and hop aroma. Nice moderate bitterness, pretty high for a Witbier. Very refreshing with oranges in the after-taste. Medium bodied with a smooth texture and an average carbonation. Great beer.
Wypite jakis czas temu, ocena w ramach uzupelnienia profilu. Jedno z najbardziej orzezwiajacych piw jakie pilem, pozycja obowiazka na lato

Bottle, 500 ml. Pours hazy yellow with high white head. Aroma is citrus, pine, sweet fruits, fresh pineapple, grass, some herbs. Taste is pine, grassy, citrus, pineapple, resin, fresh, herbs, peppermint, some grain. Very nice, refreshing and bitter beer!
Review written before I made ratebeer account. From what I remember it was not particularly witbiery and somewhat unbalanced in flavor, overly bitter.

Sourish wheaty aroma. Some spiciness, but its basically washing-up liquid. So much starch in the taste. Malts come over as very lagery. Weak shit with too much starch.

Hazy, lemon color, rich white head, but frothy after a while. Very nice aroma of citrus and coriander with only a touch of American hops. Light bodied, lively carbonation. Very refreshing and drinkable. Medium grapefruit bitterness. Very good!

Tap @RCBF 2016. Hazy light brown color. Small size, white head, stays. Oranges, fruity, sweet in aroma. Fanta-like aroma. Oranges, herbal, coriander, sweet in taste. Oranges and fruity in aftertaste. Fizzy carbonation. Very light body and easy to drink. Drinkable brew.

500ml bottle. The head is rich, even too rich, and persistent. Nice hoppy bitterness, but the elements characteristic of witbier are disruptive rather than enriching for this beer. Too sweet and unbalanced as for my taste, although I like the underlying idea.

UPDATED: AUG 6, 2014 Very hazy, orange colour with huge head, nut not long lasting. Very intensive aroma of american hops (lots of exotic citrus) with coriander and orange. Rich nose. Taste is typical for witbier, medium sweet, slightly bitter with some sour note. Drinkable and refreshing. Over medium body. High carbonation. Another tasty beer from Doctor Brew.

UPDATED: AUG 30, 2014 Bottle into glass. Good aroma, light coriander with a strong accent of orange peel, great fruity aroma from american hops. Also... black currant. Beer in the glass looks very nice, rich head, quite hazy, yellow liquid. Pleasure to watch. ;) Tastes like a typical witbier,light sweetness. Very lightly bitter. Highly carbonated beer, very refreshing.
Great beer overall. One of the best brewed in Poland, next to Kormoran Witbier.

Nice orange colour, with big white, long lasting, head on it. No doubt it is an american witbier, cause the hops are very strong in the aroma, and result in pretty high bitterness as well. Very highly carbonated.

Appearance: very nice hazy orange with very tall white head. Aroma orange, lemon a bit spicy, hoppy. Taste: very well ballanced bitterness with sweetness and sourness. Mango, citruses, some honey some spicyness. Overall really good american witbier. For me the best Doctor Brew beer.

In taste you can feel awesome american hops and coriander. The bitterness is smooth, not too long, not too aggressive. Great beer.

Bottle, pours golden, hazy with white head. Delicate citrus aroma with notes of coriander and hay. Taste is malty, cereal with light bitterness. Light body, even bit watery, but refreshing. Not bad

Bottle. Pours hazy golden with small white head. Aroma is grapefruit, citrus fruits, coriander, grass. Rather dry. Nice bitter finish, that combines both hops and orange peel. Low body, a bit watery in good refreshing way. Good, refreshing beer.

Bottle. Hazy, pale golden in colour with bug and stable head. In aroma coriander, citruses, malt, grass and flowers. In taste citrus flavour, a little bit sour with malt and yeasty backbone; medium bitter end. Low body, high carbonation makes this beer verry drinkable. Very interesting beer from drbrew.

Bottle. Very good aroma of orange, coriander and hops. Bitter citrus flavour with notes of orange and malt. Aftertaste is medium bitter and slightly acidic. Carbonation is high, low body. Very nice and refreshing drink.

Appearance: hazy orange color, poor white head.
